metadata.Title: CVE-2017-17741 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
The KVM implementation in the Linux kernel through 4.14.7 allows attackersto obtain potentially sensitive information from kernel memory, aka awrite_mmio stack-based out-of-bounds read, related to arch/x86/kvm/x86.cand include/trace/events/kvm.h.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-17741` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-144-generic - 3.13.0-144.193
linux-image-3.13.0-144-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-144.193
linux-image-3.13.0-144-lowlatency - 3.13.0-144.193
linux-image-3.13.0-144-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-144.193
linux-image-3.13.0-144-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-144.193
linux-image-3.13.0-144-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-144.193
linux-image-3.13.0-144-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-144.193
linux-image-3.13.0-144-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-144.193
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-144-generic - 3.13.0-144.193
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-lowlatency - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-119-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-119-generic - 4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1016-aws - 4.4.0-1016.16
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-144.193').
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').

linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-119.143~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1016.16').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
